description: Play as Zero, kill the robots and save the day

v0.1.0.description:
Initial playable alpha. Very bare bones but should be fully playable.
## General Information
- As of right now, the only thing randomized are the secret disks that are found in levels. Each one is a location check and an AP item.

- To beat the game, players must defeat the final boss while collecting a configurable number of secret disks (default: 80). You can set this number using the required_secret_disks option in your YAML file.

- There is another option to always give the player an S ranking. Remember that this will also give each boss a new attack, making the game harder.

- You *should* be able to use savestates throughout the game without anything breaking.

## Options

- `goal`:  
  - `default` – Beat the final boss*with enough Secret Disks (default).
  - `vanilla` – Beat the final boss regardless of disks.

- `required_secret_disks`:  
  Set the number of disks needed for completion. Default is 80, max is 160.

- `easy_ex_skill`:  
  Gives you S-Rank at the end of every stage, guaranteeing EX Skill rewards. Will make some bosses harder.

## Known Bugs
- Opening a disk then loading a level will cause the disk to be unloaded the next time the hub is revisited. This one is pretty egregious and will be fixed asap.

- There are only 160 Secret Disks, the 20 disks that appear in the hub areas are currently not implemented in AP due to how I have the memory reading set up. They are still collectable in game, but they are just not going to be items or location checks.

- Save states have the possibility to screw things up, but I am not sure where.

- Theres probably some more bugs especially with world generation; I haven't really tested this too much. Seriously please help out.



## Planned Features
- The primary planned feature is more routing changes. 
  - Like how Mega Man 2 limits the available robot masters you could fight until you have the proper AP item, this world should likely do the same. 
  - Limiting Zero's default abilities (wall climb, dash, charge attack, sword combo) like how Mario World does it can also work. Although it would require editing the first level, as it cannot be completed without wall climbing.
- Fix hub area items to be collectable. 
- Deathlink support.
- Filler items (Energy Crystals, Health, Extra Lives). These are in the item pool but are currently unimplemented.
- EX Skills as optional location checks.
- Other collectables as location checks. Like static health pickups, extra lives, etc.
- Have skippable cutscenes unlocked by default. Right now having a completed save game on your file allows you to skip most cutscenes, but this should likely be a Rom edit or something similar.
- Let the player leave every level at will. By default you can only escape levels that you have beaten previously. This will be much more important later once the routing changes are implemented.

---
If you have any questions, feel free to contact me on Discord: Stingrays110, though I'd prefer if you kept it to the Zero channel on the Archipelago Discord

v0.1.3.description:
Fixed several bugs and rewritten some back end code. Be sure to check out the readme for more information before downloading.
## Changes
- Getting a game over no longer sends unintentional items. Previously it would take all archipelago items sent to you, and send them all back as location checks.
- Items collected during the games demo playback are no longer counted as location checks.
- Potentially fixed an elusive bug where it would send every single location check all at once when you finish a level. This might not be fully fixed though.
v0.1.3.title: Mega Man Zero 3 APWorld v0.1.3

v0.1.4.description:
Update to the item and location names for each item. Each location check has a description of where to find it, and each item has a location of what the secret disk contains.

Thank you to facetraccoon on the Archipelago discord for charting out all of the items!

Next update will likely add elemental chips and suit upgrades to the item pool, so stay tuned!

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/brodieberger/MMZero3Archipelago/compare/v0.1.3...v0.1.4
v0.1.4.title: Mega Man Zero 3 APWorld v0.1.4

v0.1.5.description:
Hopefully the first ROM edit of many. This is a simple change at first, as I was getting used to the work flow of romhacking. This change will be more important as I begin to implement more routing changes. By then, entering and exiting levels will be more important.
## Changes
- Modified vanilla escape system via rom edits. You can now leave levels that you have not beaten before, except for the tutorial mission and missile factory, as those can cause issues.
v0.1.5.title: Mega Man Zero 3 APWorld v0.1.5

v0.1.6.description:
Added e-Reader changes as items! 68 of the secret disks in game are purely lore related and don't do anything meaningful for the player when given. Coincidentally, there are 68 total graphical changes that can be applied from the Japanese exclusive e-Reader. So, when receiving these lore secret disks, you will also automatically have a graphical change applied.

Right now it is on by default with no way to disable. In a future update I will make this a toggle-able option, along with some other customization options.

## Changes
- e-Reader graphical changes are added as a result of receiving certain secret disks from 111 to 180.
- Re-added ability to escape level from the hub area. It wasn't really causing any issues, and its useful for teleporting back to the command room.
v0.1.6.title: Mega Man Zero 3 APWorld v0.1.6

v0.1.7.description:
Cutscenes are now skippable by default. Note that not every cutscene is skippable, but most story sequences, mission intros, and boss intros should be fully skippable on a fresh save file.

If you are a new player, I highly recommend checking out the [readme](https://github.com/brodieberger/MMZero3Archipelago) before playing. It contains information on the world, as well as known bugs and planned features.

# Changes
- Any cutscene that is skippable on repeat playthroughs can now be skipped immediately.
- Rewrote logic for preventing player from opening disks on the results screen. Changed from a sketchy RAM insertion to ROM logic edit.
